breakfast.name: Chickpea Flour Pancakes
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Spring onions and chili flakes for topping
instructions: Mix chickpea flour, water, turmeric, salt, and pepper to form a smooth batter.
Heat a non-stick pan and pour ladlefuls of batter to make pancakes.
Cook until golden brown on both sides.
Top with spring onions and chili flakes.

lunch.name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Rinse quinoa under cold water.
In a medium pot, bring water to a boil. Add quinoa, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes or until water is absorbed.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, tomatoes, bell pepper, red onion, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Pour over quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

dinner.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Stir in quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff bell pepper halves with the mixture and place in a baking dish.
Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until peppers are tender and cheese is melted.

breakfast.name: Tofu Scramble Tacos
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon turmeric, salt to taste, Tortillas
instructions: Sauté crumbled tofu in olive oil until lightly browned.
Add nutritional yeast, turmeric, and salt. Mix well.
Warm tortillas and fill with tofu scramble and sautéed veggies.

lunch.name: Chickpea and Avocado Wrap
instructions: In a bowl, mash chickpeas and avocado together.
Stir in lemon juice, tahini, garlic, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Spread the chickpea mixture evenly onto each tortilla.
Top with shredded lettuce, grated carrot, cucumber slices, and red onion.
Roll up the tortillas and cut in half before serving.

dinner.name: Vegetable Shepherd's pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cook lentils in vegetable broth until tender, about 20-25 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Add carrots, peas, and corn, cook for another 5-7 minutes.
Stir in cooked lentils, tomato paste, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Transfer mixture to a baking dish and spread mashed potatoes on top.
Bake for 20 minutes until the top is golden brown.

breakfast.name: Avocado Toast
instructions: Toast the bread slices until golden brown.
Mash the avocado in a bowl and mix in the lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread the avocado mixture evenly on the toasted bread.
Sprinkle red pepper flakes on top, if using.

lunch.name: Lentil and Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add bell pepper, zucchini, and broccoli, stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Stir in cooked lentils, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and ginger. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds before serving.

dinner.name: Vegetable stir-fy and Brown Rice
instructions: Cook brown rice according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add bell peppers, snap peas, and broccoli, stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Stir in soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve stir-fry over brown rice and garnish with sesame seeds.

breakfast.name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Peppers
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened..
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, spinach mixture, feta cheese, and sun-dried tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the bell pepper halves with the quinoa mixture and place in a baking dish.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until peppers are tender.

lunch.name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
instructions: Layer the Greek yogurt, granola, and mixed berries in a bowl or glass.
Drizzle honey on top before serving.

dinner.name: Eggplant Parmesan
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Dip eggplant slices in beaten eggs, then coat with a mixture of breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry eggplant slices until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
In a baking dish, layer marinara sauce, eggplant slices, and shredded mozzarella cheese.
Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until cheese is bubbly and golden.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

breakfast.name: Overnight Oats
instructions: In a jar or bowl, combine rolled oats, almond milk, chia seeds, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir well, cover, and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, stir the oats and top with diced fruit before serving.

lunch.name: Tofu and Vegetable curry
ingredients: 1/4 cup kalamata olvies, pitted and sliced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, olives, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour over salad and toss to combine.
Serve the salad with a side of hummus for dipping.

dinner.name: Mushroom and Spinach Risotto
instructions: In a saucepan, heat vegetable broth and keep warm.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Add Arborio rice and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour in white wine and cook until absorbed.
Gradually add warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed before adding more.
Stir in mushrooms and cook until tender.
Add fresh spinach and cook until wilted.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

breakfast.name: Smoothie Bowl
instructions: Blend banana, frozen berries, almond milk, and almond butter until smooth.
Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
Top with granola, fresh berries, and chia seeds before serving.

lunch.name: Veggie Scramble
instructions: Blend banana, frozen berries, almond milk, and almond butter until smooth.
Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
Top with granola, fresh berries, and chia seeds before serving.

dinner.name: Veggie Tacos
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add bell pepper and zucchini, cook for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Stir in black beans, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet over medium heat.
Assemble tacos by filling tortillas with the veggie mixture, avocado slices, and fresh cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

breakfast.name: Banana Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, mix almond milk, mashed banana, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Heat coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.

lunch.name: Tofu and vegetable curry
ingredients: 1 cup green beans trimmed and cut
instructions: In a large pot, heat coconut oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, sauté for 3-4 minutes.
Stir in curry powder and turmeric, cook for another minute.
Add coconut milk, carrots, and green beans. Bring to a simmer and cook until vegetables are tender.
Add tofu cubes and baby spinach, cook for another 5 minutes until spinach is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

dinner.name: Cauliflower and chickpea curry
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, sauté for 3-4 minutes.
Stir in curry powder, turmeric, and cumin, cook for another minute.
Add cauliflower florets and chickpeas, stir to coat with spices.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cook until cauliflower is tender, about 15-20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
